data.title: Sri Lanka: country data and statistics
data.meta_description: Sri Lanka in numbers: demographics, economy, energy, climate and more data and comparisons with other countries.
data.text:
Geography

Sri Lanka is an island state in the Indian Ocean about 60 km from the Indian mainland. The land has a total area of 65,610 km² (25,332 mi²) and a total coastline of 1,340 km (832.6 mi). This land area is approximately 82% of the area of Maine. Sri Lanka is thus the 17th smallest country in Asia and ranked 123rd in the world. A considerable share of the inhabitants (81%) belongs to the rural population.

Sri Lanka is comparatively low at an average elevation of 228 meters above sea level. The highest mountain peak (Pidurutalagala) is at 2,524 meters. In addition to the main island, around 80 other small islands still belong to the country. India is the only directly neighboring country of Sri Lanka. The distance between New York City and the Capital Colombo is about 14,100 km (8,761 mi).
